meta.name: UptimeRobot Alerts to Telegram with Visual Verification

parameters.content:
# 1. Gmail Trigger

## How it works:
Gmail Trigger runs on regular intervals and checks for new emails from sender: alert@uptimerobot.com

## Configuration:

1. Choose/Create **Credentials to connect with** for the Gmail account that will receive email notifications from UptimeRobot
2. Configure **Poll times** (default is every 5 minutes)
3. _(Optional)_ Adjust the sender filter if the email doesn't match the one you are receiving emails from.

# Extract ID and URL

## How it works:
This node parses UptimeRobot alert emails to extract:
- Monitor dashboard URL
- Monitor ID (9-digit number)

## Key Functions:
1. Uses regex to find UptimeRobot monitor links in email text
2. Extracts two key pieces of information:
   - `monitorUrl`: Full dashboard URL
   - `monitorId`: The 9-digit monitor ID

## Technical Details:
```javascript
const regex = /\[(https:\/\/dashboard\.uptimerobot\.com\/monitors\/(\d{9})\?[^\]]*)\]/;
// Matches URLs in the email body like: 
// [https://dashboard.uptimerobot.com/monitors/798811078?...]
```
## Troubleshooting:
- If extraction fails, verify UptimeRobot email format hasn't changed
- Check the regex pattern matches current alert emails

# 2. Workflow settings

## How it works:
Central hub for all workflow settings. Controls screenshot behavior and parameters when enabled.

## Configuration:

1. **Basic Settings**:
   - `take_screenshot`: Set `true`/`false` to enable/disable screenshots
   
2. **Screenshot Parameters** (if enabled):
   - `screenshotmachine_secret`: Your secret phrase from ScreenshotMachine
   - `screenshotmachine_device`: `desktop` or `mobile`
   - `screenshotmachine_dimension`: Recommended `1366xfull` for full-page
   - `screenshotmachine_format`: `png` (recommended) or `jpg`

## Pro Tip:
Test different dimensions/devices to find the optimal screenshot configuration for your monitored websites.

# 3. UptimeRobot Settings

## How it works:
Fetches detailed monitor status using the extracted monitor ID from email alerts.

## Configuration:
1. **Credentials Setup**:
   - Get API key from UptimeRobot dashboard
   - Requires "Monitor Read" permissions
   - [Follow n8n documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/uptimerobot/) for setup

2. **Email Integration**:
   - Ensure your UptimeRobot monitor is configured to send alerts to your Gmail
   - Configure in UptimeRobot: 
     `Dashboard ‚Üí Monitor ‚Üí Alert Settings ‚Üí Add Email Alert`


## Pro Tip:
Test API connection using UptimeRobot's API tester before configuring in n8n.

# 4. ScreenshotMachine (Optional)

**Only needed if `take_screenshot=true` in Config**

## Credential Setup:
1. Create free account at [screenshotmachine.com](https://www.screenshotmachine.com/)
2. Configure credentials as:
   - **Type**: Generic Credential Type
   - **Auth Type**: Query Auth
   - **Name**: `key`
   - **Value**: [Your Customer Key]

## Plan Limits:
‚ùó Free plan includes limited amount of screenshots/month. If you monitor a lot of websites or receive notifications often consider a paid plan.

# 5. Telegram Setup

## Essentials:
1. Create bot via [@BotFather](https://t.me/BotFather)
2. Get your Chat ID using [@getidsbot](https://t.me/getidsbot)
3. Configure credentials:
   - **Bot Token**: From @BotFather
   - **Chat ID**: Your target channel/group

## Notification Types:
- Always sends text alerts
- Includes screenshots when enabled in Config

[Official n8n Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.telegram/)

Extract ID and URL.html:
Go to monitor →

google.com is down.

Hello Guybrush Threepwood,

We just detected an incident on your monitor. Your service is currently down.

We will alert you when it's up again.

Monitor name

google.com

Checked URL

https://google.com

Root cause

DNS Resolving problem

Incident started at

2025-03-28 21:29:19

View incident details
Comment incident

TIP: Never miss an incident, with recurring notifications.

You can set the frequency of alerts for a period of downtime.

Upgrade your account.

This email was sent by UptimeRobot. You can update your alert preferences in the dashboard.
